rules: Rule1: If the worker can use the hammer, then the work is completed successfully.
Rule2: In the event that the worker is qualified for power tools, if the worker can use the drill, then the work is completed successfully.
Rule3: Should the worker have passed basic training, then the worker is qualified for power tools.
Rule4: It happens that the worker passed basic training or that the worker has experience in construction.
Rule5: Either the worker is authorized for heavy machinery, or if the worker has experience in construction, then the worker is qualified for power tools.
Rule6: When the worker lacks certification for crane operation, it is not the case that the worker is authorized for heavy machinery.
Rule7: Either the worker lacks certification for crane operation, or the worker has no license for forklift.
Rule8: In the case that the worker has no license for forklift, it is not true that the worker is authorized for heavy machinery.
Rule9: Whenever the safety inspector is present at the site, it is not the case that the safety inspector found a violation with the equipment.
Rule10: Under the condition that the safety inspector is present at the site, the safety inspector did not approve the operations.
Rule11: Either the safety inspector is present at the site, or the work is completed successfully.
Rule12: If the worker can use the saw, then the work is completed successfully.
Rule13: Should a stop work order be issued by the safety inspector for the area, then the safety inspector issued a warning to the worker.
Rule14: In the event that the safety inspector ordered an evacuation of the site, then the safety inspector issued a stop work order for the area.
Rule15: Provided that the worker can use the nail gun, the worker is qualified for air tools.
Rule16: Either the worker can use the nail gun or the worker can use the compressor.
Rule17: Under the condition that the worker can use the compressor, the work is completed successfully.

Rule18: In the event that the safety team reviewed the tool inspection, then if the foreman checked the tool safety, then if it is not the case that if the worker is qualified for air tools then the work is completed successfully, then an accident did not occur to the worker due to a tool mishap.
Rule19: Either the safety team reviewed the tool inspection or the compliance officer audited the equipment.

Rule20: Should the compliance officer have audited the equipment, then if the foreman checked the tool safety, then if it is not true that if the worker is qualified for air tools then the work is completed successfully, then an accident did not occur to the worker due to a tool mishap.

Rule21: Provided that the hazard team identified a risk, then if it is not the case that if the safety inspector is present at the site then the safety inspector found a violation with the equipment, then the safety inspector issued a stop work order for the area.
Rule22: In the case that the supervisor has a permit for electrical work, it is not true that the supervisor has training in electrical safety.
Rule23: Under the condition that the safety manager scheduled an inspection, then if the safety inspector is present at the site, then the safety inspector approved the operations.
Rule24: When the weather delayed the inspection, then the inspection was cancelled due to weather.
Rule25: Either the weather delayed the inspection or the safety manager scheduled an inspection.
Rule26: Should the worker have been injured in a tool accident, then an accident did not occur to the worker due to a tool mishap.
Rule27: If management reported a safety breach, then if the safety officer documented the incident, then if the worker mishandled the equipment, then the worker was injured in a tool accident.
Rule28: Under the condition that the safety department implemented new rules, management reported a safety breach.
Rule29: When the workers were trained in new procedures, then the workers followed the safety rules.
Rule30: Provided that the workers followed the safety rules, then the workers violated the safety protocols.
Rule31: In the case that the workers followed the safety rules, it is not the case that the workers violated the safety protocols.
Rule32: Under the condition that the OSH team determined the cause, an accident did not occur to the worker due to a tool mishap.
Rule33: If the worker disputed the findings, then the worker appealed the conclusion.
Rule34: Provided that the worker disputed the findings, it is not true that the worker accepted responsibility.
Rule35: Either the worker disputed the findings, or if the OSH team investigated the accident, then the OSH team determined the cause.
Rule36: In the event that the worker appealed the conclusion, then the worker accepted responsibility.
Rule37: Should the worker have requested an electrical permit, then if the supervisor has a permit for electrical work, then the supervisor has training in electrical safety.
Rule38: Under the condition that the supervisor approved the electrical work, then if the supervisor has a permit for electrical work, then the supervisor has training in electrical safety.

Rule39: Provided that the project manager confirmed the permit check, then if the safety officer verified the permit status, then if it is not true that either the worker requested an electrical permit or the supervisor approved the electrical work, then the electrical installation was not completed.
Rule40: In the case that it is not true that either the worker can use the hammer or the worker can use the saw, then the supervisor has a permit for electrical work.

Rule41: When it is not the case that if the safety inspector is present at the site then the safety inspector found a violation with the equipment, then the safety inspector ordered an evacuation of the site.
Rule42: Provided that it is not true that if the worker is qualified for air tools then the work is completed successfully, then an accident occurred to the worker due to a tool mishap.
Rule43: Under the condition that it is not true that if the worker is qualified for air tools then the work is completed successfully, then the worker mishandled the equipment.
Rule44: In the event that it is not the case that if the worker is qualified for air tools then the work is completed successfully, then the OSH team investigated the accident.
Rule45: When it is not the case that either the worker requested an electrical permit or the supervisor approved the electrical work, then the electrical installation was completed.
Rule46: In the case that the hazard team did not identify a risk, then the hazard team mitigated a danger.
Rule47: If the hazard team did not identify a risk, then it is not the case that the hazard team mitigated a danger.
Rule48: Under the condition that the safety department did not implement new rules, then the workers were trained in new procedures.
facts: Fact1: The worker can use the drill.
Fact2: The foreman checked the tool safety.
Fact3: The safety officer documented the incident.
Fact4: The safety officer verified the permit status.
Fact5: The project manager confirmed the permit check.
Fact6: It is not true that the safety inspector issued a warning to the worker.
Fact7: The inspection was not cancelled due to weather.
